data: Consider oral nutrition for mild, improving pancreatitis. Naso-gastric (NG) drainage only for vomiting and/or distension. Enteral nutrition for severe pancreatitis, ideally by way of a soft, post-pyloric feeding tube; if not improving within 48 hours of care perform serial C-reactive protein (CRP) with CT scanning to assess extent of pancreatic necrosis
Remember to consider, where alcohol intake was significant, the need to cover withdrawal and to co-ordinate future re-assessment

Consider monitoring in intensive care. Indications for close monitoring:   - APACHE II score greater than 8 in the first 24 hours of admission  - Persistent SIRS greater than 48 hour  - Elevated hematocrit greater than 44 percent, urea greater than 20 mg/dL or Creatinine Level greater than 1.8 mg/dL  - Age greater than 60 years
Low Fibre, Dental Soft/Easy to Chew
Reason for Consult: Enteral nutrition, Tube feeding recommendations as per dietitian
Continuous fluids should only be for 24 hours and reassess in AM
